info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 10:45AM EST until January 12 at 7:55AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Henderson and Transylvania Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River Near Fletcher affecting Henderson and Buncombe Counties. .A potent storm system produced 5-7 inches of rainfall across the upper French Broad River watershed from early Tuesday morning through Tuesday afternoon. This rainfall quickly overwhelmed saturated soils and resulted in excessive runoff and significant stream rises across Transylvania and Henderson counties, with widespread Minor to Moderate flooding. This excessive flow caused the upper French Broad River from Rosman downstream to Brevard, Blantyre, Etowah, and Fletcher to exceed Moderate Flood Stage. Inundation effects within the river valley will continue to recede. Tributaries feeding the French Broad River have crested and fallen back below bankfull levels and the mainstem French Broad River floodwave has passed Rosman. Therefore, the French Broad River downstream at Blantyre is expected to crest overnight tonight. Significant and damaging flows along Mud Creek have caused the French Broad River near Fletcher to rise consistently through the evening hours on Tuesday. However, Mud Creek has crested and the floodwave is approaching the French Broad River confluence near Fletcher. Therefore, the French Broad River will crest near Fletcher overnight tonight and is not expected to approach the Moderate Flood Stage of 17.00 feet. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Broad River near Fletcher. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. French Broad River floodwaters are now inundating Banner Farm Rd. Floodwaters may be approaching portions of Glenn Bridge Rd. Farmland and other low-lying areas within the French Broad River Valley from Etowah to Avery Creek are experiencing scattered flooding. Glenn Bridge Park and river access is experiencing scattered flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EST Thursday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 6.6 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 01/25/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued before Friday morning at 800 AM EST.
